item.title: Difference between Concurrent Processing and Parallel Processing
item.author: kourtneylee1611@gmail.com (Kourtney Lee)
item.description:
Both ‘Concurrent Processing’ and ‘Parallel Processing’ refer to multiple processes executing on the CPU within a period,
but they are two different things.

According to The Art of Concurrency,
Concurrent means:
